sen.j: 巨勢野足（こせ の のたり、天平21年（750年） - 弘仁7年12月14日 (旧暦)（817年1月9日））は、平安時代初期の将軍、政治家。
sen.e: "KOSE no Notari" was the army general & politician in the early Heian period, whose birth year was 750 and death date was January 9, 817.
"KOSE no Notari" was an army general & politician in the early Heian period, whose birth year was 750 and death date was January 9, 817.
KOSE no Notari (750 - January 9, 817) was an army general and politician in the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。表記訂正しました。&をandに訂正しました。

sen.j: 武内宿禰の五男許勢小柄を祖とする巨勢氏の直系。
sen.e: He was the direct descendant of the Kose clan whose ancestor was "KOSE no Okara," the fifth son of "TAKEUCHI no Sukune."
He was the direct descendant of the Kose clan whose ancestor was "KOSE no Okara," the fifth son of "TAKEUCHI no Sukune."
He was the direct descendant of the Kose clan whose ancestor was KOSE no Okara, the 5th son of TAKEUCHI no Sukune.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。5thと訂正しました。

sen.j: 正四位下式部大輔左中弁兼河内守巨勢苗麻呂の長男。
sen.e: Notari was the oldest son of "KOSE no Naemaro" who reached "Shoshiinoge" (Senior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade), and assumed "Shikibu no taifu" (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial), "Sachuben" (Middle Controller of the Left) and "Kawachi no kami" (the governor of Kawachi Province).

Notari was the oldest son of "KOSE no Naemaro" who reached "Shoshiinoge" (Senior Fourth Court Rank, Lower Grade), and assumed "Shikibu no taifu" (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial), "Sachuben" (Middle Controller of the Left) and "Kawachi no kami" (the governor of Kawachi Province).

Notari was the oldest son of KOSE no Naemaro who reached Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), and assumed Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial), Sachuben (Middle Controller of the Left) and Kawachi no kami (the governor of Kawachi Province).
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。Court 削除しました。

sen.j: 従三位参議左大弁巨勢堺麻呂の嫡孫。
sen.e: Notari was the descendant of the oldest son of "KOSE no Sakaimaro" who reached "Jusanmi" (Junior Third Rank) and assumed "Sangi" (Royal Advisor) & "Sadaiben" (Major Controller of the Left).
Notari was the descendant of the oldest son of "KOSE no Sakaimaro" who reached "Jusanmi" (Junior Third Rank) and assumed "Sangi" (Royal Advisor) & "Sadaiben" (Major Controller of the Left).
Notari was the descendant of the oldest son of KOSE no Sakaimaro who reached Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and assumed Sangi (Royal Advisor) and Sadaiben (Major Controller of the Left).
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。&をandに訂正しました。

sen.e: Notari was the father of "KOSE no Koshu."
Notari was the father of "KOSE no Koshu."
Notari was the father of KOSE no Koshu.
Notari was the first "Kurodo no to" (Head Chamberlain).
Notari was the first "Kurodo no to" (Head Chamberlain).
Notari was the first Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).

sen.j: 子孫に巨勢金岡がいる。
sen.e: "KOSE no Kanaoka" was his descendant.
"KOSE no Kanaoka" was his descendant.
KOSE no Kanaoka was his descendant.

sen.j: 蝦夷征討では坂上田村麻呂らとともに副将として活動。
sen.e: As the vice general, he led the punitive expedition army to Ezo with "SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro."
As the vice general, he led the punitive expedition army to Ezo with "SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro."
As the vice general, he led the punitive expedition army to Ezo with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.

sen.j: 大同 (日本)5年（810年）には、藤原冬嗣とともに蔵人頭になるなど、政界でも重んじられていたことがわかる。
sen.e: In 810, he was appointed to Kurodo no to along with "FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu," which shows he was highly valued also in the poltical community.
In 810, he was appointed to Kurodo no to along with "FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu," which shows he was highly valued also in the poltical community.
In 810, he was appointed to Kurodo no to along with FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu, which shows he was highly valued also in the political community.
